bibdata.title: Handles availability for new work order type
Indexing 856 Content on Records without any Holdings or Portfolios

comments.body:
@mzelesky and I reviewed, exported and indexed the record locally. The ark url is in dspace. For arks that are in urls and are in figgy even though we removed the portfolio (manually edited the record in the local dev environment), the viewer would still display because we are doing the orangelight id look up. 
For this issue there should be a further review of indexed arks in a url `856 4`. https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/d982936992ef54baff5ae20788b81202cab93238/marc_to_solr/lib/princeton_marc.rb#L376

figgy.title: Rescue fixity error caused by orphaned file sets
Delay commits until the end of the reindexing process.
Add varchar-casted ID as an index.
add figgy namespace to rake tasks
Handle an archival object not being found when trying to synchronize a DAO.
CSV-migrated item-level metadata for scanned resources from Historic Postcards Finding Aid Collection is not displaying in DPUL Collection.

comments.body:
Cool . Ok. @tpendragon, if converting  to simple resources makes JSON-LD display in DPUL then conversion for the lot of item level ingest for [Postcards](https://figgy.princeton.edu/catalog/ae59ec0a-e462-4029-b09d-9d2d8100b8f6) and  item level ingest for [Grounds and Buildings collection that is pudl0038](https://figgy.princeton.edu/catalog/a3d75c94-2eee-47b7-b193-3b09eb9b13e7) in Figgy needs to happen before PUDL can be sunsetted.  

*FYI: Items in pudl0038 noted above are not displaying in figgy, as they are still suppressed based on being members of MVWs. fwiw,  @escowles noted that you just reindexed figgy and if we swap to that index, it would probably fix this (but did mention that your reindex was probably a test and that we would need to put figgy into read-only mode to do the switch for real)
Oh, the PUDL0038 items are still members of MVWs — I thought they had been removed but not reindexed for some reason. Is it OK if we remove them from the MVWs?
please do! The MVWs are being used for nothing now from what I understand, and folks would prefer the item level collection like PUDL.

@kelea99 👍🏻 Cliff or I can do that

@tpendragon Should I convert these to SimpleResources at the same time as long as I'm touching them? Do I just set `scanned_resource.change_set = "simple"` to do that?
That's how you change them, yes. I'd try one out first and make sure it does what you want - I'm just guessing it'll work okay.

It does indeed fix the metadata indexing — I did a test item and all the metadata comes over now: https://dpul.princeton.edu/catalog/474299713

I'll run a script to do this for all of them.

orangelight.title: Search results API calls to bibdata vs SRU
Search results batch API calls in groups of 10

comments.body: In my testing it looks like calls in batches of 10 MMS_IDs seem to have a more constant response time (1-3 seconds), which is what ExLibris predicted.
